excerpt: to this day he continues to lead one of the biggest hedge funds out there in the world in 72 Asset Management which currently holds a record more than $32 billion of assets under management in fact this past year Cohen was so successful in raising investor Capital that they literally had to stop alowing people from investing with the hedge fund so that they can just maximize the return for their already existing Uh current clients which is kind of crazy you know to have so much demand given the weak macroeconomy yet you have all of these investors and Rich Elites wanting to invest with Cohen or through Cohen because of you know his ability to beat the market and generate big returns

purchase number one is going to be Edwards Life Sciences SEC symbol ew which was a brand new addition to the portfolio at over $280 Million worth of stock and by the way all of all of the purchases that we're going to run through today they were big ones big increases but this was a brand new addition and uh even though it's worth so much money you know close to 300 million well it's still only worth less 1% of the overall portfolio cuz it's just so massive anyway now if you've never heard of this company well ew is a medical device specialist particularly producing them for heart disease and critical care monitoring in fact they really pioneered the trans catheter heart valves what we call tavr that uh don't require the patient to have open heart surgery for using them well uh this year in particular should see a big rise in sales thanks to their nextg version of that called sapen 3 that is made from uh cow heart tissue and it features anti-calcification technology so it's a bit of a a big um Innovation there the a big upgrade that they're making to it now the company also makes systems for monitoring a patient's heart functions and it's also been one of the most popular choices in healthcare for being an all-in-one AI enabled platform any way the company has benefited from these Innovations especially in recent years given the rising age of large populations like for for example the baby boomer generation as heart disease is sadly the number one cause of death in America and as such ew projects a double digigit rise in both sales and profits each year for the foreseeable future so it looks like Cohen you know sees the opportunity there to invest in something that is going to be generating some substantial growth now whether that turns out to be uh you know exactly 100% accurate totally true or not well we'll have to wait and see but at the moment the stock is performing pretty well with over 16% gains so far this year however from the top this normally strong performing stock is actually down about a third of its value and look I would agree that right now is probably a good time to buy on that dip given how strong the company is and you know their projections for the future but the only reason why I don't think I'll be adding uh any of it myself anytime soon is because well number one the valuation is pretty rich Trad significantly higher than the sector on most metrics and number two I already own a rival that I like much more in metronic which is the biggest medical device producer in the world not only has a much cheaper valuation over 20% lower than the sector and over 50% cheaper than ew but it also has one of my favorite dividends out there with over a 3% yield and close to five Decades of consecutive growth IW does not pay a dividend by comparison and while I might like them for other reasons I'm still going to have to rank them around the middle for now at number three since I don't think I'll be buying any of the stock myself anytime soon

moving on to purchase number two though we have a gigantic increase of over 1,400 per in the media giant Fox cor ticker symbol foxa uh bringing the stake up to over $300 million which was actually a new addition in the prior quarter making this still a fairly new position uh for Coen 2 now uh Fox is of course well known for their TV properties their Fox News media and also Fox Sports but if you're not aware they actually used to be a lot larger before Disney acquired much of their assets and brands in the 21st Century Fox deal which resulted in this now smaller uh Fox Corporation kind of being spun out uh from that back in 2019 now since then fox has still maintained leadership in several areas notably in broadcast and cable television where the Fox News Channel continues to be the number one most watched television news channel for over two decades in a row while the entire news Media Group also reaches over 200 million people every month now Fox Sports is also very popular capable of reaching over a 100 million people in a single weekend as well while Fox Entertainment continues to broadcast many popular shows like The Simpsons a couple Gordon Ramsey shows they acquired the animation studio behind Bobbers they have TMZ the max sing masked Masked Singer and a lot more in total though Fox TV stations uh also own and operate close to 30 full power broadcast stations in the US and they also have a growing online streaming presence as well which includes by the way their acquisition of tub it's a popular ad supported platform that has even uh grown to more users then get this Max peacock and Paramount plus that's pretty crazy as good as all of that is though performance has actually been pretty choppy with profits declining these past couple years by about half the amount that they did in 2021 and although sales have at least risen during that time they're now Falling by over 6% this year before expected to return to growth next year now much of that is because of of course regular television uh declining for years now with people kind of cutting the cord and switching to online streaming which is also a very competitive landscape for them too and while I do think that fox does have a lot of contents that can be used in their own apps or even be licensed out to other platforms well I would just rather get my exposure to Video Entertainment through much larger more Diversified companies like you know maybe Disney or even Amazon that I feel are much lower risk I mean take Amazon for example they've been doing pretty well with Prime video especially after acquiring MGM which helped them produce the hit new Fallout show which has been very popular and again they're a much larger more Diversified and just overall safer company to invest in at least in my opinion but Fox on the other hand it's actually seen their stock price continue to fall ever since the spin-off and while that does at least give them a super cheap valuation I just think there's safer options out there with more growth opportunity and for that reason I'll have to rank them pretty low here at number four because of it

moving on to purchase number three though we actually have a much better stock in my opinion arguably one of the best value stocks in the entire market right now and that is the digital payments leader PayPal ticker symbol PPL which Cohen increased his position on by a giant more than 800% in the quarter bringing the stake up to over $300 million and yeah I can clearly understand why he would choose to do that as PayPal has now fallen by over 80% from the highs that they reached during the pandemic to now one of the lowest prices in their entire history now valuation wise you can't really judge them compared to the sector because you know Finance usually contains very cheap Bank stocks but compared to fintex at least PayPal is actually very cheap and over 60% lower than their own 5year average as well which add a p ratio of only around 12 to 14 I mean you're just not likely to find that kind of value among fintex and yet PayPal is actually the leader of their respective Market with over 45% market share in payment processing technology according to statista now the company has also been solidly profitable for years and while growth has been the biggest concern coming off the pandemic where free cash flow has now been stagnant for years too while they are at least generating around 5 billion of that every year which by the way most of that is being used to buy back a ton of their own stock while it's still currently low which I do strongly agree with unfortunately though we did also see Revenue growth fall from a double digit rate in 2021 to now a single digit rate going forward as it's just a little harder to grow in this environment coming off the pandemic which on top of that you know investors are also worried that the market is getting more heavily saturated with competition like stripe like square or block and there's even indirect players like Google play Apple pay and uh even Amazon pay which is where I like to get most of my exposure to those markets I own all three of those Google Apple and Amazon uh I will also say though that I actually did pick up some of this stock this past week for our community portfolio after running a poll where I asked you guys which new stock should we add to the portfolio to which over 40% of the votes actually went to PayPal and by a pretty large margin too so I think you guys are seeing the same value here mixed with turnaround potential given the rising markets of digital payments e-commerce and even online advertising too and that's something that I see as well and by the way it's not just us that feel this way but also many analysts who have uh price targets well above where PayPal currently trades today anyway I think this stock is mostly a buy here so I'm going to rank it pretty high at number two and above everything else that we've seen so far on this list

coming in at purchase number four we have the Telecommunications giant AT&T ticker symbol T which Cohen more than doubled his position on this past quarter adding millions of more shares and bringing the stake up to well over $400 Million worth now when it comes to AT&T I actually used to really like them myself and was even heavily invested in them before I switched for their biggest rival in Verizon but the reason why I initially liked AT&T was for their strong cash generating business in Telecom which they were able to use to pay a huge dividend and they even had a little diversity too pushing into video streaming through HBO Max however much of this bullish thesis started to erode over time as the company was riddled with massive debt from the giant Acquisitions of Direct TV which by the way they paid a whopping uh $67 billion for including debt only to later spin it off for just 16 billion and they also acquired Time Warner media which they paid over100 billion for only to later spin that one off too resulting in a $47 billion loss and also no longer having video streaming that that service what we call Max now uh to show for it either as a result of these and many other mistakes so AT&T's Financial growth has been pretty much flat while also being forced to cut their dividend by almost half which had previously been increased for 35 years in a row before being cut now that's not to say that it's it's all bad news here as the dividend still yields over 6% they continue to generate billions in cash flow and that's both operating and free and even though their business is less Diversified now while telecommunications at least continues to be a cash cow for them and that's something that I don't think is likely to disappear anytime soon plus the stock is trading near a decade low with a dirt cheap valuation around 40% cheaper than the sector but the only reason why I still refuse to buy the stock myself is because I just like Verizon a bit more namely for their higher quality business as they've consistently won more quality awards for decades which I do feel gives them a Competitive Edge Plus the stock is just as cheap with also a fantastic dividend and so while I can see why someone uh might want to pick up AT&T for that value I just prefer Verizon a little bit more myself and because of that I'm going to have to keep PayPal ahead of them and push it up to the number one spot so I can fit this one in with all of that said though we are now left with the fifth and final purchase

I switched for their biggest rival in Verizon... I just like Verizon a bit more namely for their higher quality business as they've consistently won more quality awards for decades which I do feel gives them a Competitive Edge Plus the stock is just as cheap with also a fantastic dividend

we are now left with the fifth and final purchase which is also the largest position of the list and that is none other than broadcom ticker symbol avgo which was actually another new addition to the portfolio however he did own it a few quarters prior before then selling out and now buying back in so it's kind of like a readdition here anyway this turned out to be a great pickup because broadcom has soared by even more recently after reporting very strong q1 earnings where they beat on both the top and bottom line thanks to strong demand for their AI custom chips and services that they Supply to other businesses for example analyst from Goldman Sachs had this to say alongside Nvidia we view broadcom as a critical piece to the ongoing AI infrastructure buildout and we reiterate our buy rating on the stock it's kind of crazy right comparing it to Nvidia we know how hot they've been uh also we had Bank of America comment and they said uh they also reiterated their buy rating and they added that broadcom is their top AI pick how crazy is that because of its leading position to grow in custom AI chips and ethernet networking while also being able to upsell VMware to Enterprise customers deploying AI which of course sets off the heels of that massive $69 billion acquisition of the virtualization cloud computing and even cyber security specialist where they'll likely see now a ton of synergy within the two businesses being combined into one anyway as a result broadcom has not only risen by almost 60% just this year alone but it's also up over 550% in the past 5 years too and yet its PEG ratio is actually just only slightly higher than the sector because of how even more profitable they're expected to become in the future which I also strongly agree with myself as broadcom has been on fire these past few years with soaring financials on both the top and bottom line while while this year to is expected to see revenues Climb by another 40% plus thanks to that acquisition which even after that they're still expected to rise by another double digigit percent next year as well now I do worry a little though that uh you know this one might be a little price to Perfection at this point given that the valuation is like 100% higher than their 5-year average so I could understand perhaps ranking PayPal higher uh because of that however I actually own broadcom stock myself in my personal portfolio and I love what they're doing so I just got to give them that number one spot regardless
